bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Insurance (Vehicle) Act;

actual cash value means the average market price a purchaser would have paid for an insured vehicle or other insured property immediately before loss or damage occurs to the vehicle or other property;
acupuncturist means a person entitled to practise acupuncture under the Health Professions Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;
additional product certificate means a certificate issued under section 149, 154.2 or 154.9;
amphibious vehicle means a vehicle that is designed or adapted for operation on both land and water;
application, when used in respect of an application to the corporation relating to the plan, means an application in a form established by the corporation and signed by the applicant;
bus means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a motor vehicle used

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: at any time on a highway to carry passengers for compensation from an airport to limited predetermined points or from those points to an airport,
at any time on a highway exclusively for the conveyance of a person or group of persons to whom or for whose use the vehicle is chartered at a fixed price for the use of the whole vehicle,
to transport, without direct compensation, passengers who have a connection with the business activities of the owner or renter of the motor vehicle,

at any time on a highway over a regular route or between fixed terminating points and on a regular time schedule by, for or on behalf of any person who charges or collects compensation for the transportation of passengers in or on the motor vehicle, and available for use by the public, or
as a school bus or special activity bus as defined in section 1 of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a commercial motor vehicle owned or rented by a religious organization and used exclusively for the transportation of passengers for purposes related to the religious activities of the organization;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: camper means a removable structure designed to be mounted on a motor vehicle to provide facilities for human habitation or camping;
chiropractor means a person entitled to practise chiropractic under the Health Professions Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;
combination of vehicles means every combination of a motor vehicle with another vehicle;
commercial motor vehicle means a motor vehicle that is registered and licensed as a commercial vehicle under the Commercial Transport Act or Motor Vehicle Act;
commercial use means use of a vehicle for the delivery or carriage of goods;
commission means the British Columbia Utilities Commission continued under section 2 of the Utilities Commission Act;
counsellor means a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: who is a member in good standing of an association whose members provide the health care services of clinical or counselling psychology,
who holds a master's degree or doctorate in psychology, psychiatry, social work or clinical or counselling psychology, and

whose health care services of clinical or counselling psychology are overseen by a person who is a member of a health profession as defined in the Health Professions Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: courtesy car means a licensed vehicle rented or lent to a customer by a garage service operator as a temporary substitute for a licensed vehicle

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the customer has entrusted to the care, custody or control of a garage service operator for repair or servicing, or
the garage service operator has taken from the customer as payment or part payment for the purchase of another motor vehicle that is to be delivered to the customer;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: cycle means a cycle as defined in Part 3 of the Motor Vehicle Act;
dealer means a dealer as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act;
declared value means the value declared by the owner of a vehicle to the corporation in a declaration of value;
dentist means a person entitled to practise dentistry under the Health Professions Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;
excluded vehicle means excluded vehicle as defined in section 113 of the Act;

garage service operator means the operator of a motor vehicle service facility and includes a dealer, service station operator, motor vehicle repairer, auto body shop repairer, wrecker operator and the operator of a vehicle parking or storage facility;
gross vehicle weight means gross vehicle weight as defined in the Commercial Transport Act;
household means every person ordinarily residing in the same dwelling unit;
implement of husbandry means an implement of husbandry as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act but does not include a farm tractor;
kinesiologist means a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: who is a member in good standing of an association whose members provide the health care services of kinesiology, and
whose health care services of kinesiology are overseen by a person who is a member of a health profession as defined in the Health Professions Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: leased vehicle means a vehicle rented under a written agreement for a period of not less than one month;

lien holder means a secured party under the Personal Property Security Act, a garage keeper under the Repairers Lien Act or any other person claiming an interest in a vehicle if the person has registered a financing statement in the personal property registry;
limousine use means use of a motor vehicle for rental or hire with driver on an hourly basis but does not include a rental or hiring with driver of less than one hour;
massage therapist means a person entitled to practise massage therapy under the Health Professions Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;
Memorial Grant Program for First Responders means the Memorial Grant Program for First Responders established by the government of Canada;
motorcycle means a motorcycle as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act;
non-standard motor vehicle means non-standard motor vehicle as defined in section 113 of the Act;
number plate means number plate as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act;
occupational therapist means a person entitled to practise occupational therapy under the Health Professions Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;
occurrence means a single happening or a series of happenings arising from a single event;
passenger directed vehicle has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Passenger Transportation Act;
passenger directed vehicle authorization has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Passenger Transportation Act;
physician means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a medical practitioner;
a person who is authorized, by a body in a jurisdiction outside British Columbia that regulates the practice of medicine in that other jurisdiction, to practise medicine;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: physiotherapist means a person entitled to practise physical therapy under the Health Professions Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;
premium-related debt means one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the interest that has accrued on an unpaid premium under section 15.71;
a service charge imposed by the corporation

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: under section 15.8, or
for a declaration of entitlement for a new certificate;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a default paid by the corporation in accordance with section 58.1 (3);
interest, charges or fees imposed by the corporation for financial assistance given by it in respect of all or part of the premium, or licensing or registration fees;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: psychologist means a person entitled to practise psychology under the Health Professions Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;
snow vehicle means a snow vehicle as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58;
snowmobile means a snowmobile as defined in the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58;

spouse means a person who is married to another person or who is living in a marriage-like relationship with that other person for at least 2 years immediately preceding the date on which the right to claim benefits or insurance money arose;

taxi means a vehicle, other than a bus or a TNS-only vehicle, that is operated at any time on a highway by, for or on behalf of any person who charges or collects compensation for the transportation of passengers in or on the vehicle, and that is available for hire, with driver, by the trip;
territory means, in relation to the plan, a region of British Columbia established by the corporation under section 34 (2) (a) of the Act;
TNS vehicle means either of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a TNS-only vehicle;

a motor vehicle, other than a taxi with an owner's certificate that has an effective date on or before April 30, 2020, operated as a passenger directed vehicle under a passenger directed vehicle authorization and a transportation network services authorization;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: TNS-only vehicle means a motor vehicle operated as a passenger directed vehicle under a transportation network services authorization only;
transportation network services authorization has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Passenger Transportation Act;
U-drive means a vehicle available for hire or rental, without driver, by the hour or otherwise, for a period of less than one month, but does not include a courtesy car;
vehicle rate class means, in relation to the plan, a class or subclass of vehicles established by the corporation under section 34 (1) of the Act;
vessel means a ship, barge, boat or other description of vessel used or designed to be used in navigation but does not include a rowboat or a raft, logboom or other similar floating facility.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the Act and this regulation, motor vehicle includes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a farm tractor, and
an implement of husbandry that is operated on a highway and is deemed under section 2 (6) of the Motor Vehicle Act to be registered and licensed under that Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "health care practitioner" in section 1 (1) of the Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following classes of persons are prescribed with respect to paragraph (c) of that definition:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: acupuncturist;
chiropractor;
dentist;
massage therapist;
occupational therapist;
physiotherapist;
psychologist, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following classes of persons are prescribed with respect to paragraph (d) of that definition:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: counsellor;
kinesiologist;
a person who is authorized, by a body in a jurisdiction outside British Columbia that regulates the practice of medicine in that other jurisdiction to practice medicine.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this regulation a reference to a certificate, policy, endorsement, permit or licence is a reference to a valid and subsisting certificate, policy, endorsement, permit or licence.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The plan provides insurance coverage as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: coverage under Parts 10 and 11 of the Act and Parts 6, 7 and 10 of this regulation;
in the case of a garage vehicle certificate, coverage to a garage service operator for loss or damage to customers' vehicles that are in the care, custody or control of the garage service operator.

bcl:section.bcl:hnote: [en. B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 3, as am. by B.C. Reg. 46/2007, Sch. 1, s. 1; am. B.C. Reg. 62/2021, App. 4, s. 3.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless otherwise provided in an additional product certificate or in Parts 10 or 11 of the Act, the Act and this regulation do not apply in respect of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a vehicle licensed under section 9 of the Motor Vehicle Act while the vehicle is being operated off a highway,
a vehicle exempted under section 1.01 or 1.02 of the Act whether or not the vehicle is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in combination with an insured vehicle, or
operated by a person named in a driver's certificate,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a trailer while being drawn otherwise than by vehicle power or human power,
a vehicle being operated by remote control without a driver in the vehicle,
an aircraft except when the aircraft is being drawn as a trailer on a highway,
a vehicle being used in a contest, show or race, or in advanced or performance driver training, if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the activity is held or conducted on a track or other location temporarily or permanently closed to all other vehicle traffic, and
there exists an element of race or speed test,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an amphibious vehicle when being used in or upon water, when docked or floating in water, or when being launched into or landed from water, or

a vehicle that is fitted with wheels of the crawler type, including track conversion kits, rubber track conversion systems and rubber tracked crawlers, while the vehicle is being operated off a highway, except if that vehicle is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: licensed under section 10 of the Motor Vehicle Act, or
a snowmobile or a snow vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In subsection (1) (f), element of race or speed test means driving at high speed, and includes passing maneuvers, driving in close proximity to another vehicle or assessing vehicle limitations in speed, acceleration, turning or braking.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 5.]
For the purposes of section 29 (b) of the Act, the following information is prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: details of the person's job, including the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the job title;
the job description, including a description of the duties and responsibilities of the job;
a description of the physical and mental demands of the job;
the hours of work;
if the person worked shifts, information about the shift;
the person's working conditions;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the requirements or qualifications required for the person's job, including certifications, education, skills, professional licences, specialized knowledge and work experience;
information about the person's work history, including the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the start date in each job with the employer;
the last day worked in each job with the employer;
whether the accident occurred in the course of the person's employment;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: whether the employer was planning to promote, or change the person's job duties, before the date of the accident;
information about how the accident has affected the person's employment, including how much time the person has been off work due to the accident;
information about the person's return-to-work plan, including the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: information about the plan for the return to the person's job, including the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the timeline for the return to work;
a description of modified duties;
a description of the person's modified work schedule;
a description of the person's modified working conditions;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: information about workplace barriers that might have a negative impact on the return-to-work plan and may result in the need to provide accommodation for the person;
information about support systems to support the person's return-to-work plan;
updates on how the person is progressing in the return-to-work plan;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: information about the person's eligibility for remuneration, including the following information:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: information about other compensation, within the meaning of section 122 of the Act, the person may be entitled to, or is receiving, including the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: benefits under the Workers Compensation Act;
paid sick leave;
short-term and long-term disability benefits;
extended health benefits;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the value of the personal use of a vehicle provided by the employer before the date of the accident;
the cash value of a profit-sharing plan at the person's employment of which the person is a member;
the value of the employer's contribution to the person's pension plan lost because of the accident;
the cash value of any other benefit that the person received, or was entitled to receive, in the 52 weeks before the date of the accident;
information about any additional remuneration provided by the employer;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person's record of employment within the meaning of section 19 of the Employment Insurance Regulations under the Employment Insurance Act (Canada).

bcl:section.bcl:text: Application for a certificate issued in conjunction with any type or category of licence or number plate may be made to a person appointed as an agent of the corporation for that purpose or authorized in writing by the corporation for the purposes of section 3 of the Motor Vehicle Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Pending approval by the corporation of an application for an owner's certificate, the person receiving the application shall, subject to section 15.7 and on payment of the applicable premium and any premium related debt, issue to the applicant an interim owner's certificate.
An interim owner's certificate issued under this section or section 6 is valid until the owner of the vehicle described in the interim owner's certificate receives an owner's certificate.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 234/2018, App. 2, s. 5.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An owner who has received from the corporation an APV-1, APV-1A or APV-2 form or a notice to renew may make application for renewal of an owner's certificate to a person mentioned in section 3.

On approval of the application mentioned in subsection (1) and payment to the corporation of the premium set out in the APV-1, APV-1A or APV-2 form or the notice to renew and any premium related debt, the person to whom the application is made shall issue and validate the owner's certificate.

Where an owner does not receive an APV-1, APV-1A or APV-2 form or a notice to renew, or the form is lost or destroyed, the owner may make application to a person mentioned in section 3 for an owner's certificate.

On approval of the application mentioned in subsection (3) and payment to the corporation of the applicable premium and any premium related debt, the person to whom the application is made shall issue to the applicant an owner's certificate.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 25 (3) and (4) of the Interpretation Act does not apply in respect of renewal of a certificate, and a certificate is not in force in the interval between its expiry and renewal.
An applicant for an owner's certificate for a leased vehicle shall set out in the application form

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of the owner, followed by the word "lessor",
the name of the renter of the vehicle, followed by the word "renter", and
the address in the Province of either the owner or the renter of the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, the territory in which the vehicle is primarily located when not in use means the territory in which the place where the vehicle is kept when not being driven is located.
The insured named on an owner's certificate must,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within 10 days after

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the insured's address is changed from the address set out in the certificate, or
the insured acquires a substitute vehicle for the vehicle described in the certificate, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: before

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the use of the vehicle described in the certificate is changed to a use to which a different vehicle rate class applies than the vehicle rate class applicable to the use set out in the certificate, or

a vehicle in respect of which the premium is established on the basis of the territory in which a vehicle of that vehicle rate class is used or principally used, as the case may be, is used or principally used in a different territory than that set out in the certificate,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: report the change of address, vehicle, use or territory to a person referred to in section 3, and pay or be refunded the resulting difference in premium.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the premium for a vehicle is established on the basis of the territory in which the vehicle is primarily located when not in use and that territory as set out in the owner's certificate is changed, the insured named on the certificate must, unless the vehicle is being used by the insured for vacation purposes, report the change to a person referred to in section 3 within 30 days of the change, and pay or be refunded the resulting difference in premium.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An owner's certificate validated by the corporation evidences that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an insured, as defined in sections 63, 78, 147 and 148.1 of this regulation, has coverage under Part 6, Part 7, section 147 and Division 2 of Part 10 of this regulation respectively,
an insured, as defined in section 113 of the Act, has coverage under Part 10 of the Act, and
an insured, as defined in section 170 of the Act, has coverage under Part 11 of the Act

bcl:part.bcl:text: Premiums for Universal Compulsory Vehicle Insurance

The effective date of an owner's certificate issued in conjunction with a quarterly licence shall be deemed to be the first day of January, notwithstanding the actual first quarter date of issue of that licence or the date of issue of quarterly licences for the other quarters of the year.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 14.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where the corporation is required to refund a premium and, through no fault of the person entitled to the refund, the corporation fails to pay the refund within 60 days after the day the refund was applied for, the corporation shall add to the amount of the refund interest for the period from the end of the 60 days to the date payment is made.
Interest under this section shall be paid at the rate established by the corporation in the rate schedule in effect on the date of the refund.
In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: COVID-19 pandemic has the same meaning as in section 1 of the COVID-19 Related Measures Act;
government directive has the same meaning as in section 3 (4) of Special Direction IC2 to the British Columbia Utilities Commission, B.C. Reg. 307/2004;

rebate means a rebate referred to in an application by the corporation to the commission, in accordance with a government directive, for changes to rates in support of a rebate in connection with the COVID-19 pandemic.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the corporation is required to pay a rebate, the corporation is not required to make payment if the amount of the rebate is less than $1.
The amount of any rebate must be rounded to the nearest dollar and an amount ending in $.50 must be rounded up to the next dollar.

If the corporation is required to pay a rebate and fails to pay the rebate within 6 months after the effective date of changes to rates in support of the rebate under the government directive, the corporation must add to the amount of the rebate interest for the period from the end of the 6 months to the date payment is made.
Interest under this section must be paid at the rate referred to in section 15.2 (2) that is in effect on the date payment is made.

In this section, rebate means a rebate referred to in the corporation's application to the commission in accordance with the government directive dated November 30, 2020, for changes to rates, including a rebate, in connection with the Attorney General Statutes (Vehicle Insurance) Amendment Act, 2020.
If the corporation is required to pay a rebate, the corporation is not required to make payment if the amount of the rebate is less than $1.
The amount of any rebate must be rounded to the nearest dollar and an amount ending in $.50 must be rounded up to the next dollar.

If the corporation is required to pay a rebate and fails to pay the rebate by November 1, 2021, the corporation must add to the amount of the rebate interest for the period from November 1, 2021 to the date payment is made.
Interest under this section must be paid at the rate referred to in section 15.2 (2) that is in effect on the date payment is made.

In this section, rebate means a rebate referred to in the corporation's application to the commission in accordance with the government directive dated March 24, 2022, for changes to rates in support of a relief rebate.

If the corporation is required to pay a rebate and fails to pay the rebate within 6 months after the effective date of changes to rates in support of the rebate under the government directive, the corporation must add to the amount of the rebate interest for the period from the end of the 6 months to the date payment is made.
Interest under this section must be paid at the rate referred to in section 15.2 (2) that is in effect on the date payment is made.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 16.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Rounding of premiums, refunds and discounts

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any premium payable or refundable in respect of an owner's certificate or an additional product certificate shall be added to any fees payable or refundable under the Motor Vehicle Act or Commercial Transport Act in respect of the vehicle described in the owner's certificate or additional product certificate, and, subject to subsection (2), the total shall be the amount payable by or refundable to the person named on the owner's certificate or additional product certificate, but no payment shall be required and no refund shall be made if the rounded total is less than $5.
The amount of any premium, refund or discount shall be rounded to the nearest dollar and an amount ending in 50¢ shall be raised to the next higher dollar.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Premiums triggered by accidents involving unlisted drivers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The corporation may assess a premium against an applicant to whom an owner's certificate has been issued, in addition to any premium assessed for the certificate before it was issued, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the vehicle specified in the certificate is involved in an accident while the certificate is valid, and
at the time of the accident, the driver of the vehicle is not named on the certificate as a driver of the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A premium may be assessed under subsection (1) whether or not the certificate is valid when the premium is assessed.

A person against whom a premium is assessed under subsection (1) must pay the amount of the premium by the date specified by the corporation and the amount is a debt due and owing to the corporation on that date.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 16.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, registrant means a person registered as the owner of a vehicle, or a person renting a vehicle as a leased vehicle, as the consequence of a transfer or rental agreement that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is not transacted at arm's length between the registrant and a prior registered owner, renter or person renting the vehicle to another person, and
is for the purpose of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: assisting the prior owner, renter or person renting the vehicle to another person to evade paying a debt due and owing to the corporation, or

permitting the prior owner, renter or person renting the vehicle to another person to continue to have the benefit or use of the vehicle without paying a debt due and owing to the corporation or without making an arrangement with the corporation for payment of the debt.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a registrant obtains an owner's certificate or an additional product certificate in respect of a vehicle referred to in subsection (1) without having paid all of the unpaid premium owing for, or premium related debt owing in respect of,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the coverage afforded the prior registered owner, renter or person renting the vehicle to another person by an owner's certificate, or
an additional product certificate issued to the prior registered owner, renter or person renting the vehicle to another person,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: an amount equal to the total of the unpaid premium, plus any premium related debt, is a debt due and owing to the corporation by the registrant.

If the registrant does not, within 30 days after the corporation has mailed to the registrant at the registrant's last address, according to the corporation's records, a written demand for payment of the debt referred to in subsection (2) together with a notice of any action the corporation intends to take under this section, pay the debt or make arrangements satisfactory to the corporation for payment of the debt, the corporation may do one or more of the following for so long as any part of the debt remains outstanding:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: recover the debt by action in a court of competent jurisdiction;
refuse any further application for insurance by the registrant until the debt is paid;
cancel the owner's certificate or additional product certificate and any other owner's certificate or additional product certificate issued in the registrant's name, whether or not

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the full premium was paid for the registrant's owner's certificate or additional product certificate or other owner's certificate or additional product certificate, and
the debt arises from an owner's certificate or additional product certificate issued for a preceding term;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: cancel a driver's certificate issued in the registrant's name;
issue an additional product certificate or an owner's certificate to the registrant with a term of more than 90 days but less than one year.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Without limiting section 15.7 (3), the corporation may recover interest on unpaid premium and premium related debt.

For the purpose of section 41 of the Act, an arrangement mentioned in section 15.7 (3) of this regulation or a similar arrangement made under section 166 (1) (b) of this regulation does not constitute a default in payment of premium, but if any person defaults in respect of a term of the arrangement, section 15.7 (3) applies to the debt in relation to which the arrangement was made.

The following are jointly and severally liable to the corporation to pay for premium or premium related debt owing to the corporation in respect of an owner's certificate or an additional product certificate:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: each registered owner of a vehicle for which the owner's certificate or additional product certificate is issued;

each registered owner and each renter of a leased vehicle for which the owner's certificate or additional product certificate is issued, regardless of whether the registered owner or the renter paid for the insurance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The corporation may recover a service charge from a person who makes a payment to it by a cheque, bill of exchange or order to pay, the payment of which is not made by the savings institution on which it is drawn when it is presented for payment, whether in person or through another savings institution.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the production of a cheque, bill of exchange or order to pay on which is marked "pursuant to clearing rules, this item must not be cleared again unless certified", or other words importing that payment was not made by the savings institution, is evidence that payment was not made.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The corporation may set the amount of the charge payable to the corporation for the issue of the classes of certificates respecting coverage for the types of high-value vehicles designated by the corporation for this purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), if a taxi is insured but not as part of a fleet under Part 12, the corporation and the owner or renter of the taxi may enter into an agreement, effective May 1, 2020, to adjust the amount of the premium for the certificate to insure the taxi based on the following factors:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the distance over which the taxi is operated between May 1, 2020 and the expiry of the certificate;
where the taxi is operated between May 1, 2020 and the expiry of the certificate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The corporation may enter into an agreement referred to in subsection (1) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certificate to insure the taxi is either of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a certificate issued as a result of the approval of an application made under section 3;
an interim owner's certificate issued under section 4,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certificate has an effective date

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: on or after April 30, 2019, and
on or before April 30, 2020, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certificate is valid on May 1, 2020.

subject to paragraph (a.1), at the beginning of the day following each subsequent anniversary date of the driver's birth,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: unless suspended, cancelled or revoked under the Act or this regulation, a driver's certificate is valid and of effect until the earlier of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the date on which the driver's licence expires, and
the end of the day on the next anniversary date of the driver's birth,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person named on a driver's licence shall be deemed to be the person named on the driver's certificate,

the signature of the president of the corporation on a driver's licence shall be deemed to be the signature of the president of the corporation on the driver's certificate deemed to be incorporated in the driver's licence, and

an application for the issue, renewal, replacement or reinstatement of a driver's licence shall be deemed to be an application to the corporation for the issue, renewal, replacement or reinstatement of a driver's certificate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 257/86, s. 10.]

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 30.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a premium is payable for a driver's certificate, the corporation must mail to the person named in the certificate a notice of assessment of premium for the period specified in the notice.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 257/86, s. 12.]
The total amount set out in the notice of assessment of premium under subsection (1) is payable to the corporation by the person named on the driver's certificate in accordance with that notice.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 31 (b).]

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 30.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Rounding and prorating of premiums and refunds

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any premium payable to or refundable by the corporation under this Part shall be rounded to the nearest dollar and an amount ending in 50¢ shall be raised to the next higher dollar, but no premium is payable or refundable if the rounded premium is less than $2.

Where the term remaining unexpired in a driver's certificate on the day it is issued is less than one year, the amount of premium payable by the applicant for the certificate is the amount established by the corporation prorated for the number of days remaining unexpired on the day the certificate is issued.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Sections 7 and 15.7 apply in respect of a driver's certificate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 49.1, the corporation must indemnify an insured who is not in default of premium payable under section 45 for liability imposed on the insured by law for injury or death of another or loss or damage to property of another that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: arises out of the use or operation by the insured of a vehicle

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: not owned by the insured or a member of the insured's household, or
not rented to the insured as a leased vehicle or rented to a member of the insured's household as a leased vehicle, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: occurs in Canada or the United States of America or on a vessel travelling between Canada and the United States of America

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the insured is operating the vehicle without the consent of the owner and does not have reasonable grounds to believe that the insured has the consent of the owner,
the insured is operating the vehicle in connection with the business of a garage service operator,
the vehicle is owned or regularly operated by the insured,
the vehicle is used for commercial use,
subject to subsection (1.1), the vehicle is used for carrying passengers for compensation or hire,

the vehicle is in fact not licensed under the Motor Vehicle Act, the Commercial Transport Act or similar legislation of another jurisdiction and the insured does not have reasonable grounds to believe the vehicle is licensed, or
the insured is operating an all terrain vehicle licensed under section 24.04 of B.C. Reg. 26/58, the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In respect of a TNS-only vehicle operated under a transportation network services authorization, the corporation's exemption under subsection (1) (f.1) applies only if injury or death of another, or loss or damage to property of another, arises out of the operation of the TNS-only vehicle when

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the vehicle has been hailed by or for passengers through the use of the online platform to which the transportation network services authorization relates, and
the insured is operating the vehicle for the purposes of picking up, transporting or dropping off those passengers.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Sections 70 to 76 apply in respect of indemnity under this section.

Subject to sections 18 (4) and 77 (1) of the Act, where an insured is liable for injury or death of another or loss or damage to property of another, the liability of the corporation to the insured for payment of indemnity under section 49 in respect of all claims against the insured arising out of the same occurrence is limited to the applicable amount set out in section 1 (1.1) of Schedule 3.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. 34 (b).]

In addition to the amount by which liability is limited under subsection (1), the corporation shall reimburse the insured for the payments and pay the costs referred to in section 69 that are within the limit set out in section 1 (1.1) of Schedule 3.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of payment of indemnity under section 49, claims arising out of injury or death have priority over claims arising from loss or damage to property to the extent of 90% of the amount by which liability is limited under section 49.1 and, subject to section 77 (1) of the Act, claims arising out of loss or damage to property have priority over claims arising out of injury or death to the extent of 10% of the amount by which liability is limited under section 49.1.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to indemnity under section 49, a driver's certificate evidences that an insured who is not in default of premium payable under section 45 has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: coverage under Part 7, and
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 117/2021, App. 6, s. 5.]
coverage under Division 2 of Part 10.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 379/93, s. 3.]

If a driver's certificate and an owner's certificate or vehicle liability policy evidence third party liability insurance coverage for the same occurrence, the third party liability insurance coverage evidenced by the owner's certificate or vehicle liability policy is primary insurance.

Third party liability insurance coverage evidenced by a driver's certificate is available only to the extent of the amount by which the limit of liability specified in respect of the driver's certificate exceeds the total of the amounts specified in an owner's certificate or vehicle liability policy.

bcl:section.bcl:hnote: [en. B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 37, as am. by B.C. Reg. 46/2007, Sch. 1, s. 5.]

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 38.]
Where an owner of a vehicle described in an owner's certificate

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: acquires, during the term of the owner's certificate, another vehicle in substitution for the described vehicle,
transfers title to or interest in the described vehicle, and
removes the number plates from the described vehicle, in accordance with section 3.05 of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations, B.C. Reg. 26/58, and displays them on the substitute vehicle,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the coverage evidenced by the owner's certificate applies in respect of the substitute vehicle for a period of 10 days from the day the owner acquires the substitute vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An owner's certificate issued to an applicant who has complied with section 8 evidences coverage under Parts 6 and 7 and Division 1 of Part 10 for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the renter, and the renter's household,
the driver assigned by the renter to operate the leased vehicle and that driver's household, and
every person operating the vehicle with the renter's consent.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A reference in subsection (1) to a renter includes a subrenter of the renter.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Where a person acting under the authority of a lien holder takes possession of a vehicle under the lien holder's right of repossession, the coverage in force in respect of the vehicle at the time it was repossessed is extended to and continues in force for the benefit of that person, the lien holder and the owner, if the person acting under the authority of the lien holder

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: moves the vehicle immediately and as directly as reasonably possible to the nearest safe place of storage, and
at the place of storage immediately removes the number plates from the vehicle and delivers them to the owner or corporation.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 42.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, insured means an insured as defined in section 42, 63, 65, 78 or 148.1 (1) and includes an insured under an additional product certificate or a fleet reporting certificate issued under section 168.
The corporation is not liable to an insured who breaches a condition of this section or is deemed under subsection (7.1) or (8) to have breached a condition of section 49 and Part 6.

An insured must not operate a vehicle for which coverage is provided under section 49 or Part 6 contrary to the statements contained in the application for insurance for the vehicle, including, but not limited to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the use declared in the application for insurance for the vehicle,
a statement relating to the time during which, and the territories in which, the vehicle may be operated, and
a statement relating to the kind of goods or number of passengers that may be carried in or on the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 43 (c).]
An insured must not operate a vehicle for which coverage is provided under section 49 or 49.3 (1) (a) and (c), Part 6 or 7, or Division 2 of Part 10

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the insured is not authorized and not qualified by law to operate the vehicle,
for an illicit or prohibited trade or transportation,
to escape or avoid arrest or other similar police action, or
in a race or speed test.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An insured does not breach a condition of subsection (3) merely because the insured operates a vehicle in contravention of a restriction or condition imposed on the insured's driver's licence by section 30.06 (2), 30.07 (1) or (3), 30.071 (1), 30.08 (1), 30.10 (2) or (4) or 30.11 (1) of the Motor Vehicle Act Regulations.

An insured must not operate a motor vehicle for which coverage is provided under section 49 or Part 6 if there is attached to the motor vehicle a trailer that is required to be registered and licensed under the Motor Vehicle Act or Commercial Transport Act and is not so registered and licensed.

An insured named in a certificate or additional product certificate must not permit the vehicle described in the certificate or additional product certificate to be operated by a person or for a purpose that breaches a condition of this section or Part 6.

An insured must not operate a vehicle, in circumstances in which coverage under Part 6 is provided by a blanket certificate, if the insured does, omits to do, participates in, assents to or acquiesces in anything that results in

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a breach of a condition of the blanket certificate,
the invalidity of a claim under the blanket certificate, or
the forfeiture of a right under the blanket certificate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An insured named in an owner's certificate issued in respect of a vehicle must not permit the vehicle to be operated, in circumstances in which coverage under Part 6 is provided by a blanket certificate, if the insured does, omits to do, participates in, assents to or acquiesces in anything that results in a breach, the invalidity of a claim or the forfeiture of a right referred to subsection (5.1).
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 43 (c).]

Use of a vehicle does not contravene subsection (2) if the premium paid for the vehicle rate class applicable to the use set out in the application for insurance is greater than or equal to the premium established by the corporation for the vehicle rate class applicable to the use to which the vehicle is put.

An insured is deemed to have breached a condition of section 49 and Part 6 if the injury, death, loss or damage in respect of which the insured's claim is made is caused by or results from an intentional act of violence committed by the insured by means of a vehicle unless the insured is a mentally disordered person at the time of the act.
An insured is deemed to have breached a condition of section 49 and Part 6 if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the insured is operating a vehicle while the insured is under the influence of intoxicating liquor or a drug or other intoxicating substance to such an extent that the insured is incapable of proper control of the vehicle,
the insured is convicted of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a motor vehicle related Criminal Code offence,
an offence under section 95 or 102 of the Motor Vehicle Act, or
an offence under a provision of the law of another jurisdiction in Canada or the United States of America that is similar to a provision referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii), or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the insured is convicted of an offence committed

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: before December 18, 2018 under section 253 (1) (b) of the Criminal Code, or
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 62/2021, App. 4, s. 11 (c).]
under a provision of the law of another jurisdiction in Canada or the United States of America that is similar to a provision referred to in subparagraph (i),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: and the accident in respect of which the insured's claim is made occurred during the insured's commission of the offence and while the insured was operating a vehicle.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 62/2021, App. 4, s. 11 (f).]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In subsection (8):

bcl:definition.bcl:text: convicted includes being

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: convicted under the Youth Criminal Justice Act (Canada) for contravening

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a provision referred to in the definition of "motor vehicle related Criminal Code offence", or
in the case of a contravention occurring before December 18, 2018, a provision referred to in subsection (8) (c) (i), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: convicted or the subject of a similar result in a jurisdiction of the United States of America under a law similar to the Youth Criminal Justice Act (Canada) for contravening a provision of a law of that jurisdiction referred to in subsection (8) (b) (iii) or (c) (iii);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: motor vehicle related Criminal Code offence means any of the following offences that an insured commits while operating or having care or control of a vehicle or by means of a vehicle:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an offence under section 220 or 221 of the Criminal Code;
an offence committed before December 18, 2018 under any of the following provisions of the Criminal Code:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 249;
section 252;
section 253 (1) (a);
section 254 (5);
section 255 (2);
section 255 (3);
section 259 (4);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an offence committed on or after December 18, 2018 under any of the following provisions of the Criminal Code:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 235;
section 236;
section 239 (1);
section 320.13 (1);
section 320.13 (2);
section 320.13 (3);
section 320.14 (1) (a);
section 320.14 (1) (b);
section 320.14 (1) (c);
section 320.14 (1) (d);
section 320.14 (2);
section 320.14 (3);
section 320.15 (1);
section 320.15 (2);
section 320.15 (3);
section 320.16 (1);
section 320.16 (2);
section 320.16 (3);
section 320.18 (1).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The corporation is not liable

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: under Part 4, 6, 7 or 10 in respect of injury, death, loss or damage arising, directly or indirectly, out of radioactive, toxic, explosive or other hazardous properties of nuclear substances within the meaning of the Nuclear Safety and Control Act (Canada),

under section 20 or 24 of the Act or section 49.3, Part 7 or Part 10 in respect of injury, death, loss or damage arising, directly or indirectly out of a declared or undeclared war or insurrection, rebellion or revolution, or
under section 20 or 24 of the Act or section 49, 49.3 (1) (b), Part 6 or Part 10 in respect of punitive or exemplary damages or other similar non-compensatory damages.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) (a) does not apply to the carriage of radioisotopes that are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: packaged and labelled in accordance with the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act (Canada), and
to be used for medical treatment, research, photography, x-ray or other similar purposes using radioisotopes.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A reference in this Part to Part 6, 7 or 10 of this regulation or Part 10 or 11 of the Act includes coverage under those Parts that is evidenced by an additional product certificate or by a fleet reporting certificate issued under section 168 of this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a vehicle owned by a customer of a garage service operator is in the care, custody or control of the garage service operator or an employee of the garage service operator for a purpose relating to the business of a garage service, no coverage is provided under Part 6 or 7 of this regulation or Part 10 or 11 of the Act to the garage service operator or the employee under the owner's certificate issued in respect of the customer's vehicle.
This section does not operate to exclude

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a garage service operator or an employee of the garage service operator from coverage under an owner's certificate issued in respect of a vehicle that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the garage service operator or employee owns, and
is in the care, custody or control of the garage service operator or employee for a purpose relating to the business of the garage service operator, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a customer of a garage service operator from coverage under an owner's certificate issued to the customer, if the garage service operator

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is not insured, or is insufficiently insured, under a garage vehicle certificate, and
is liable for an accident for which the owner's certificate would, except for subsection (1), provide coverage.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 46.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: financial institution means a savings institution that, under a contractual arrangement with the corporation, agrees to provide financial assistance to an owner for the purchase from the corporation of a certificate;
owner includes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person registered as the owner of a vehicle, and
a renter of a vehicle that is rented by that person as a leased vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An owner may make application to the financial institution for financial assistance, in respect of all or part of the premium, licensing and registration fees, administrative fees and other charges agreed to by the corporation, to purchase from the corporation a certificate.

If an owner defaults on the repayment of financial assistance provided to the owner by the financial institution and the corporation pays the amount of the default by way of assignment of the debt from the financial institution, the total amount of the default, including interest and other charges, is a debt of the owner due and owing to the corporation.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 328/97, s. 4.]

Where the corporation waives a condition of section 55 that is related to rating a vehicle to determine premium, it may as a condition of insurance require the insured in whose favour the waiver is exercised to pay an amount equal to the difference between the premium paid and the premium that would have been payable if the vehicle had been correctly rated.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 48.]

bcl:section.bcl:text: Where the corporation considers that payment of a doubtful or disputed claim is in the interest of the corporation and of the better administration of the Act, the regulations or the plan, the corporation may authorize an ex gratia payment to be made.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An owner or operator of an extraprovincial undertaking who elects to give proof of financial responsibility in respect of a vehicle under section 106 (2) (b) of the Motor Vehicle Act shall be deemed to have so elected in respect of every vehicle owned by the extraprovincial undertaking or rented to the extraprovincial undertaking as a leased vehicle.

If the owner or operator of an extraprovincial undertaking obtains duplicate coverage by insuring a vehicle under an owner's certificate and under vehicle insurance issued by an insurer authorized for that purpose under the Financial Institutions Act or under a similar law of another jurisdiction, the coverage provided by that vehicle insurance is primary insurance and the owner's certificate continues to provide insurance

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of third party liability insurance coverage only to the extent that the amount by which liability is limited under the owner's certificate exceeds the amount by which liability is limited under the vehicle insurance, and
in respect of accident benefits coverage only to the extent that the benefits payable under the owner's certificate exceed the benefits payable under the vehicle insurance,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: but any coverage under the owner's certificate except the coverages described in paragraphs (a) and (b) is void.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 452/2003, s. 3.]

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 470/99, s. 1.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to an accident occurring on or after May 1, 2021.
If benefits are provided and evidenced by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an owner's certificate issued in respect of a vehicle of which an individual who sustains bodily injury caused by a vehicle

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is an operator or occupant, or
is not an operator or occupant of a vehicle and is struck by

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the vehicle, or
something other than a vehicle because of the vehicle, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an owner's certificate issued in respect of a vehicle not involved in the accident,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the benefits described in paragraph (a) are primary and the benefits described in paragraph (b) are available only to the extent that the amount of those benefits exceeds the amount of the benefits described in paragraph (a).

If benefits are provided and evidenced by more than one owner's certificate issued in respect of vehicles other than the vehicle involved in the accident, benefits are provided only under the owner's certificate that provides the greatest amount of benefits and if the amounts are equal, the corporation may determine which owner's certificate applies.

If an insured is also insured under vehicle insurance that provides compensation similar to benefits under Part 10 of the Act or that provides similar benefits or insurance under similar legislation of another jurisdiction, then,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the accident occurs in British Columbia, the vehicle insurance issued in respect of a vehicle of which the insured is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an operator or occupant, or
not an operator or occupant of a vehicle and is struck by

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the vehicle, or
something other than a vehicle because of the vehicle,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is primary, and benefits or compensation similar to benefits under Part 10 of the Act or similar benefits or insurance under similar legislation of another jurisdiction is available only to the extent that the amount that it provides exceeds the amount provided by the vehicle insurance issued in respect of the vehicle, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the accident occurs outside British Columbia but otherwise within the area described in section 118 of the Act, the liability of the corporation for payment of benefits must be determined as if the provisions of the legislation of that jurisdiction respecting terms, conditions and priorities of vehicle insurance applied in respect of benefits.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A certificate does not evidence coverage under Part 10 of the Act in relation to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a non-standard motor vehicle, if the accident does not occur on the portion of the highway on which the vehicle is authorized to be operated;
a trailer that is not an excluded vehicle, if the accident occurs off-highway;
an excluded vehicle, if the accident does not occur on the portion of the highway on which the vehicle is authorized to be operated.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part, insured means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person named as an owner in an owner's certificate,
an individual who, with the consent of the owner or while a member of the owner's household, uses or operates the vehicle described in the owner's certificate,

where the owner is deceased, the personal representative of the owner or a person having, with the consent of the personal representative, custody of the vehicle until the grant of letters probate or of administration to the personal representative, and
where the owner is not an individual,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an officer, employee or partner of the owner for whose regular use the vehicle described in the owner's certificate is provided, or
a member of the household of an officer, employee or partner of the owner, who, with the consent of the owner, uses or operates the vehicle described in the owner's certificate.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to this Part, the corporation must indemnify an insured for liability imposed on the insured by law for injury or death of another or loss or damage to property of another that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: arises out of the use or operation by the insured of a vehicle described in an owner's certificate, and
occurs in Canada or the United States of America or on a vessel travelling between Canada and the United States of America.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 292/2000, Sch. A, s. 7.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, insured means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person named as an owner in an owner's certificate,
a member of the owner's household,
an employee or partner of the owner for whose regular use the vehicle described in the owner's certificate is provided, and
the spouse of an employee or partner described in paragraph (c) where the spouse resides with the employee or partner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 77, indemnity under this Part is extended to an insured operating a motor vehicle not described in an owner's certificate issued to the insured, unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the insured is operating the motor vehicle in connection with the business of a garage service operator,
the motor vehicle is owned or regularly operated by an insured,
the motor vehicle is used for commercial use,
subject to subsection (2.1), the motor vehicle is used for carrying passengers for compensation or hire,

the motor vehicle is in fact not licensed under the Motor Vehicle Act, the Commercial Transport Act or similar legislation of another jurisdiction and the insured does not have reasonable grounds to believe the motor vehicle is licensed,
the motor vehicle is exempted under section 1.01 or 1.02 of the Act, or
the insured is operating the motor vehicle without the consent of the owner and does not have reasonable grounds to believe that the insured has the consent of the owner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In respect of a TNS-only vehicle operated under a transportation network services authorization, the corporation's exemption under subsection (2) (c.1) applies only if injury or death of another, or loss or damage to property of another, arises out of the operation of the TNS-only vehicle when

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the vehicle has been hailed by or for passengers through the use of the online platform to which the transportation network services authorization relates, and
the insured is operating the vehicle for the purposes of picking up, transporting or dropping off those passengers.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where more than one owner's certificate evidences third party liability insurance coverage of an insured under this section, the insured shall be compensated only under the certificate that provides the higher or highest limit of third party liability insurance coverage, and, if the limits are equal, the corporation may determine the certificate that applies.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Indemnity under this Part is extended to a passenger in a vehicle described in an owner's certificate who, by operating any part of the vehicle while the vehicle is being operated by an insured, causes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: injury or death to a person who is not an occupant of the vehicle, or
loss or damage to property that is not carried in or on the vehicle or in the care, custody or control of the insured.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to sections 18 (4) and 77 (1) of the Act, where an insured is liable for injury or death of another or loss or damage to property of another, the liability of the corporation to the insured for payment of indemnity under this Part in respect of all claims against the insured arising out of the same occurrence is limited to the applicable amount set out in section 1 of Schedule 3.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 53.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Limit of liability — loans and advance payments
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 83 (1) (c) of the Act, the prescribed circumstance is that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person has a claim for damages respecting a loss or expense similar to a loss or expense covered by benefits under Part 7 of this regulation,
the person receives a loan or an advance payment in relation to the loss or expense, and
the person must repay the loan or advance payment, in full or in part, if the person receives or is entitled to receive an award of damages, or enters into a settlement, in relation to the claim.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 83 (1) (f) of the Act, the prescribed circumstance is the payment of an amount under the Memorial Grant Program for First Responders.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of payment of indemnity under this Part, claims arising out of injury or death have priority over claims arising from loss or damage to property to the extent of 90% of the amount by which liability is limited under section 67 and, subject to section 77 (1) of the Act, claims arising out of loss or damage to property have priority over claims arising out of injury or death to the extent of 10% of the amount by which liability is limited under section 67.

For the purpose of the payment of claims under section 20 or 24 of the Act for accidents occurring before May 1, 2021, claims arising out of injury or death have proportionately the same priority over claims arising from loss or damage to property as is provided in subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:text: In addition to the amount by which liability is limited under section 67, the corporation shall

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: reimburse an insured for reasonable payments for emergency medical aid necessary to a person injured as the result of an accident for which indemnity is payable under this Part, if reimbursement is not provided to the insured under another Part or by another insurer,
pay costs incurred for fire extinguishers, jacks or other necessary emergency equipment or supplies provided to the insured,
pay that proportion of the costs taxed against an insured in an action respecting a claim under this Part that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount offered by the corporation as its total liability for indemnity to the insured under this Part in an offer to settle served in accordance with the Supreme Court Civil Rules

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: bears to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the aggregate of all special and general damages awarded in respect of the occurrence for which the claim is made,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: pay

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: prejudgment interest under the Court Order Interest Act or similar legislation of another jurisdiction, and
post-judgment interest under the Interest Act (Canada) or similar legislation of another jurisdiction

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on that part of the judgment that is within the applicable limit set out in section 1 of Schedule 3, and

if indemnity is provided to the insured under this Part and by one or more optional insurance contracts provided by an insurer other than the corporation, contribute to the payment of expenses, costs and reimbursements for which provision is made under section 172 in accordance with that other insurer's and the corporation's respective liabilities for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: damages awarded against the insured, or
the amount payable under a settlement made on behalf of the insured.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where an accident involves a combination of vehicles,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the corporation is not liable for more than the amount set out in the owner's certificate issued in respect of the motor vehicle providing the motive power when the accident occurs.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 56 (b).]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Notwithstanding subsection (1) (a), where

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the accident involving a combination of vehicles arises directly out of the use or operation of a trailer, and

the amount by which the liability of the corporation is limited in the owner's certificate for the trailer exceeds the amount by which its liability is limited in the owner's certificate for the vehicle providing the motive power when the accident occurs,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the third party liability insurance coverage evidenced by the owner's certificate for the trailer is available to the person named in that certificate, but only

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to the extent of the amount by which the limit of liability under the owner's certificate for the trailer exceeds the limit of liability under the owner's certificate for the vehicle providing the motive power, and
so long as the trailer is not

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: owned or rented as a leased vehicle by the person who also owns or rents as a leased vehicle the vehicle providing the motive power,
owned or rented as a leased vehicle by a member of the same household as the person who owns or rents as a leased vehicle the vehicle providing the motive power, or
part of the same fleet, or deemed to be part of the same fleet, as the vehicle providing the motive power.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The corporation shall not indemnify the owner of a vehicle that is operated as part of a combination of vehicles for liability to the owner or driver of another vehicle in the combination of vehicles.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Where an owner's certificate is issued in conjunction with a trailer licence for a motor vehicle that is capable of being operated under its own power, the corporation is not liable to indemnify the owner under that certificate if the vehicle is operated otherwise than as a trailer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, attached equipment means machinery, apparatus or equipment that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: mounted on or attached to a vehicle, and
not required for the safe operation of the vehicle on a highway.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The corporation shall not indemnify an insured for liability imposed by law for injury, death, loss or damage arising, directly or indirectly, out of the operation of attached equipment at a site where the attached equipment is being operated, unless the attached equipment

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is used for snow or ice removal from a highway or for sweeping, cleaning, sanding or grading streets,
is a side or rear mounted power-operated platform,
is attached to a vehicle used for pleasure purposes,
is attached to a vehicle used as a wrecker, dump truck or fork-lift,
is attached to a vehicle used as a garbage truck, but only if the injury, death, loss or damage did not arise, directly or indirectly, out of the operation of a crane attached to the vehicle,
is attached to a vehicle used as a front-end loader or backhoe, or
is attached to a vehicle used as a mower.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Notwithstanding subsection (2) (e), the corporation shall not indemnify an insured for liability imposed by law for loss or damage to an underground installation or resulting from loss or damage to an underground installation if the loss or damage occurs during excavation.
The corporation must not indemnify an insured under this Part in respect of any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a general or special assessment, penalty or premium payable under the Workers Compensation Act or a similar law of another jurisdiction;

liability imposed on an insured that arises out of the use or operation of an excluded vehicle or a non-standard motor vehicle when the use or operation does not occur on the portion of a highway on which the vehicle is authorized to be operated, unless a garage vehicle certificate provides coverage in respect of the insured's vehicle and the use or operation occurs off highway and while the vehicle is in the care, custody or control of a garage service operator in the course of the garage service operator's business activities and role as garage service operator;
liability imposed on an insured by law in respect of the exceptions in section 116 (2) (f) and (g) of the Act;
an amount recoverable from an insured under section 168 or 178 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Except to the extent provided under section 1 (5) (a) or (b) of Schedule 3, the corporation must not indemnify an insured under this Part in respect of loss or damage to any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: property carried in or on a vehicle described in an owner's certificate;
property owned or rented by an insured;
property in the care, custody or control of an insured.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where a claim is payable or has been paid, forfeited or denied under Part 7, the corporation must deduct the amount of the claim from any amount payable under this Part in respect of the same occurrence.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 166/2006, Sch. s. 57.]
An insured must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: promptly give the corporation written notice, with all available particulars, of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: any accident involving death, injury, damage or loss in which the insured or a vehicle owned or operated by the insured has been involved,
any claim made in respect of the accident, and
any other insurance held by the insured providing coverage for the accident,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on receipt of a claim, legal document or correspondence relating to a claim, immediately send the corporation a copy of the claim, document or correspondence,
cooperate with the corporation in the investigation, settlement or defence of a claim or action,
except at the insured's own cost, assume no liability and settle no claim, and
allow the corporation to inspect an insured vehicle or its equipment or both at any reasonable time.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The corporation is not liable to an insured who, to the prejudice of the corporation, fails to comply with this section.

bcl:section.bcl:text: On receipt of notice of a claim for damages brought against an insured for which indemnity is provided under this Part and subject to an act or omission by the insured entitling the corporation to raise any question as to whether or not the insured is entitled to indemnity, the corporation, at its expense, shall

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: assist the insured by investigating and negotiating a settlement, where in the corporation's opinion its assistance is necessary, and
subject to an application and directions given by the court under section 79 of the Act, defend in the name of the insured any action for damages brought against the insured.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to section 79 of the Act, on assuming the defence of an action for damages brought against an insured, the corporation shall have exclusive conduct and control of the defence of the action and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the corporation shall be entitled to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: appoint and instruct counsel to defend the action,
admit liability, in whole or in part, on behalf of the insured,
participate in any non-judicial process which has as its goal the resolution of a claim, and
compromise or settle the action.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to section 79 of the Act, the corporation may act as and is deemed to be the duly appointed attorney of an insured to appear and defend the insured in an action brought against the insured in another province of Canada or in the United States of America in respect of injury, death, loss or damage arising out of the ownership, use or operation of a vehicle.
No person shall commence an action to enforce a right under this Part, except within the limitation period fixed by the Limitation Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 150.1, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: insurance coverage is provided under this Part or Division 1 of Part 10 and evidenced by an owner's certificate in respect of a vehicle involved in an accident, and
insurance coverage is also provided under this Part or Division 1 of Part 10 and evidenced by a certificate in respect of a vehicle not involved in the accident,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the insurance coverage in respect of the vehicle involved in the accident is primary insurance and subject to subsection (2), the insurance coverage in respect of the vehicle not involved in the accident applies only to the extent that the amount by which liability is limited under that certificate exceeds the amount by which liability is limited under the owner's certificate in respect of the vehicle involved in the accident.
Insurance coverage provided by a certificate issued in respect of a vehicle other than the vehicle involved in an accident does not apply if, when the accident occurs, the other vehicle

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is owned or rented as a leased vehicle by the person who also owns or rents as a leased vehicle the vehicle involved in the accident,
is owned or rented as a leased vehicle by a member of the same household as the person who owns or rents as a leased vehicle the vehicle involved in the accident, or
is part of the same fleet, or deemed to be part of the same fleet, as the vehicle involved in the accident.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an insured is also insured under vehicle insurance providing insurance of the kind referred to in the definition of "owner's policy" or "non-owner's policy" in section 57.1 of the Act, or providing similar insurance under similar legislation of another jurisdiction, the liability of the corporation to provide indemnity under this Part must be determined,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if a claim is made in respect of an accident that occurs in the Province, as if section 179 applied in respect of coverage provided under this Part, and

if a claim is made in respect of an accident that occurs in another jurisdiction, as if the provisions of the legislation of that jurisdiction respecting terms, conditions and priorities of vehicle insurance applied in respect of coverage provided under this Part.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: employed person means a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: who, on the date of an accident for which a claim is made, is employed or actively engaged in an occupation for wages or profit, or
who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 257/86, s. 21.]
for any 6 months during the period of 12 months immediately preceding the date of an accident for which a claim is made is employed or actively engaged in an occupation for wages or profit;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: homemaker means the member of a household who, without payment, does the majority of the housekeeping for the household;
insured means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person named as an owner in an owner's certificate,
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 257/86, s. 21.]
a member of the household of a person named in an owner's certificate,
an insured as defined in section 42 who is not in default of premium payable under section 45,
a member of the household of an insured described in paragraph (c.1),
an occupant of a vehicle that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is licensed in the Province and is not exempted under section 1.01 or 1.02 of the Act, or
is not required to be licensed in the Province, but is operated by a person named in a driver's certificate,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a cyclist or pedestrian who collides with a vehicle described in an owner's certificate, or
a resident of the Province who is entitled to bring an action for injury or death under section 20 or 24 of the Act,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: and includes the personal representative of a deceased insured;
parent means the person entitled to claim a child as a dependant under the Income Tax Act of the Province;
rehabilitation team means a team of individuals, including representation from the rehabilitation staff of the corporation, established

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to determine the appropriate group residence for an insured,
to determine the care needs of an insured under section 88 (2) (c), and
to evaluate any aspect of the funding, development of treatment, or rehabilitation plan for an insured;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: supported child means any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person under 19 years of age for whose support an insured is legally liable and who is dependent on the insured for financial support;
a person 19 years of age or older who resides with an insured and receives most of the person's financial support from the insured because of a mental or physical disability;
a child of an insured who is born after the death of the insured and survives for at least 60 days after birth;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: supported parent means a surviving parent, including a surviving spouse of a parent, of an insured who, at the date of an accident for which a claim is made, resides with the insured and receives most of the supported parent's financial support from the insured;
supported person means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a supported child, or
a supported parent.
